fs.fibu2.data.model
Class Journal

java.lang.Object
  fs.fibu2.data.model.Journal
All Implemented Interfaces:
ReadingPointListener, XMLConfigurable, java.util.EventListener
public class Journal
extends java.lang.Object
implements XMLConfigurable, ReadingPointListener

This class implements an fsfibu2 journal. A journal is essentially an (unsorted) collection of entries together with some additional data:
- ReadingPoints: A reading point is a certain day of the year at which the user whishes to see a bilancial overview and potentially reset all sums.
- Start values: A journal contains a start value for each account it uses.
- A name and a description for this journal
All the write access methods exist in two versions: The normal one and the one that automatically creates an associated UndoableEdit and posts it to the proper JournalUndoManager. Both versions notify any Listeners of changes.

Author:
Simon Hampe

configure

public void configure(org.dom4j.Node n)
               throws XMLWriteConfigurationException
Expects the following node structure:
- Optionally the nodes name and description with arbitrary content
- An optional node called startvalues with subnodes for each account. The subnodes have as name the account id (which must be known to AccountLoader) and as text a valid float value indicating the start value for this account. All accounts for which no start value has been given will implicitely be initialized to zero
- An arbitrary number of valid ReadingPoint nodes
- An arbitrary number of valid Entry nodes
This operation is not undoable, however it will reset the associated undomanager. The journal and its UndoManager will remain completely unchanged, if any XMLWriteConfigurationException occurs.

Specified by:
configure in interface XMLConfigurable
Throws:
XMLWriteConfigurationException - - If any of the following cases holds:
- There is an account ID node with an unknown ID
- Any of the ReadingPoint or Entry nodes is faulty
- n == null
